lexUnit.name: disapprove.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have or express an unfavourable opinion.

sentence.text: He blamed it all on business , but could not resist taunting her for expecting him to be at h-er beck and call , while disapproving that he was rich .
` Do n't your family disapprove a bit ? "
` I felt you disapproved last night , " he said .
This would have been disapproved by purists .
Tournaments were disapproved of by ecclesiastics , for they could be both bloody and dangerous .
Some of the differences in aggressiveness between boys and girls may be due to the fact that parents tend to disapprove more of aggression in girls .
Author after author denounced Bush , the likely ( except to Surkov and his agent ) President of the United States , who disapproved of abortion .
My grandmother would have disapproved of Bogie for religious reasons .
Bob strongly disapproved of drinking and driving .
Did he disapprove of all social events , or only of this one -- and if so , why had he come ?
Probably the reason why her therapist disapproved of her was not because she was -- from a psychiatric standpoint -- ill , but because she would n't get better .
He believed her to have been flirting , and disapproved of it .
He disapproved of shaving , sported a beard to his navel and was a great advocate of Swedish gymnastics .
Her mother Margaret disapproves of fancy weddings and strongly disapproves of evening invitations .
` I disapprove of killing at the best of times , Ace , but , and this is vitally important , you must never kill anyone with a role in recorded history if you can possibly avoid it .
( In contrast , in other parts of India inter-caste marriages are thoroughly disapproved of . )
Activities , which society had previously disapproved of and banned , are now permitted and can be freely indulged in .
Compare the people with one another and identify what they have in common , and what you approve and disapprove of .
" There is a meeting of an organization my mother disapproves of . "
Her working-class male counterpart is not usually ridiculed or disapproved of in this way , as someone whose language is inappropriate .
Another thing she disapproved of was his passionate interest in the other sex .
He served with the Parliamentary army as a chaplain on two occasions , although he also disapproved of putting the king to death .
Just as they defended the school friends we disapproved of , so they are likely to stick to their own choice of girl or boyfriend .
Books were not returned , articles went missing and I disapproved silently .
We may disapprove -- but it is clearly within the law .
His father disapproved , but told a visitor : ` Modern young people will do what they like .
` I ` disapprove " only in so far as your adventurous inclinations affect my own family , I assure you .
